task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot onto the plate, then pick up the spatula tool and push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulation scene shows a small pot with a lid on a stovetop pad, a plate on the left, a spatula tool nearby, and a bowl at the bottom right. The robot must first remove the pot’s lid, then relocate the pot onto the plate, and finally use the spatula as a tool to push the pot toward the table’s front edge. The plan prioritizes reliable perception, stable grasps, gentle placement on the plate, and a deliberate tool-mediated push along the surface.
preconditions: Workspace clear enough to move between pot, plate, and tool
Plate is stable on the table surface
No humans within the robot workspace
stepwise_plan: Detect pot, lid, plate, and spatula
Open/remove the lid using a lid-opening action
Compute and execute a side grasp on the pot
Lift and place the pot on the plate, then release
Push the pot toward the table front using the spatula
Put the spatula down and release
success_criteria: Lid is no longer on the pot
Pot is resting centered enough on the plate without toppling
Final pot position is closer to the table’s front edge than before push
No collisions with bowl or fixtures
failure_and_recovery: If grasp is unstable, retry with the same or alternate strategy
If placement misaligns, regrasp and reposition
If push slips, re-approach and perform a shorter push
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the pot is on the plate and its final position has been shifted toward the table front, with the tool safely released.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Perceive a named object within the workspace under a timeout.
Open or remove a container closure such as a lid.
Plan a grasp pose for the specified target with a chosen strategy and store to key.
Execute a grasp at a precomputed pose using the specified strategy.
Check stability of the most recent grasp.
Lift the currently held object vertically by a distance.
Place an object on a named surface area with optional yaw and press force.
Open the gripper to a specified width.
Back away from the current interaction point.
Use a specified handheld tool to push a target along a direction and distance.
Place the currently held item down at the current position.

failure_modes: Object detection misses the lid or tool
Lid removal incomplete leaving friction on pot
Pot collides with bowl during transfer
Push causes plate to slide instead of pot
recovery_strategy: Repeat detection and adjust camera viewpoint if available
Retry grasp with alternate strategy (top/side) and adjust gripper width
Recenter over plate and re-place with reduced press force
Shorter, repeated pushes with re-approach between attempts
assumptions: Spatula is the intended tool; bottom of the image is treated as the table front
OpenContainer with container_type 'lid' models taking the lid off
Contact sheet suggests pot ends up over the plate before pushing; frames guide order when ambiguous

expected_success_criteria: Pot translated toward front via tool push
